chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
R: BSRS
ff: falsity_flag
rho: env (option (list bool))
t: term
u: string bool
v: list bool

Goal:
eval rho t = Some v -> eval rho (prep u t) = Some (u ++ v)

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
env = fun domain : Type => nat -> domain : Type -> Type Arguments env _%type_scope
Inductive option (A : Type) : Type := Some : A -> option A | None : option A Arguments option _%type_scope Arguments Some {A}%type_scope a : rename Arguments None {A}%type_scope
eval : forall domain : Type, interp domain -> env domain -> term -> domain
string = fun X : Type => list X : Type -> Type Arguments string _%type_scope
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
prep = fix prep (x : string bool) (t : term) {struct x} : term := match x with | [] => t | b :: x0 => t_f b (prep x0 t) end : string bool -> term -> term
IB_prep : forall (R : BSRS) (rho : env (list bool)) (s : string bool) (t : term), eval rho (prep s t) = s ++ eval rho t
VectorDef.map : (?A -> ?B) -> forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A n -> VectorDef.t ?B n where ?A : [R : BSRS ff : falsity_flag rho : env (option (list bool)) t : term u : string bool v : list bool |- Type] ?B : [R : BSRS ff : falsity_flag rho : env (option (list bool)) t : term u : string bool v : list bool |- Type]
enumerator__T_prod : forall (f1 : nat -> option ?X) (f2 : nat -> option ?Y), enumerator__T f1 ?X -> enumerator__T f2 ?Y -> enumerator__T (prod_enum f1 f2) (?X * ?Y) where ?X : [R : BSRS ff : falsity_flag rho : env (option (list bool)) t : term u : string bool v : list bool |- Type] ?Y : [R : BSRS ff : falsity_flag rho : env (option (list bool)) t : term u : string bool v : list bool |- Type]
ListEnumerabilityFacts.enumerator__T_list : forall L : nat -> list ?X, ListEnumerabilityFacts.list_enumerator__T' ?X L -> ListEnumerabilityFacts.list_enumerator__T' (list ?X) (ListEnumerabilityFacts.L_list L) where ?X : [R : BSRS ff : falsity_flag rho : env (option (list bool)) t : term u : string bool v : list bool |- Type]
impl_prv : forall (A B : list form) (phi : form), (rev B ++ A) ⊢ phi -> A ⊢ (B ==> phi) where ?p : [R : BSRS ff : falsity_flag rho : env (option (list bool)) t : term u : string bool v : list bool |- peirce]
der_cons : forall (P : stack ?X) (x y : list ?X) (u0 v0 : string ?X), In (x / y) P -> derivable P u0 v0 -> derivable P (x ++ u0) (y ++ v0) where ?X : [R : BSRS ff : falsity_flag rho : env (option (list bool)) t : term u : string bool v : list bool |- Type]
Ctx : forall (A : list form) (phi : form), In phi A -> A ⊢ phi where ?p : [R : BSRS ff : falsity_flag rho : env (option (list bool)) t : term u : string bool v : list bool |- peirce]
AllE : forall (A : list form) (t0 : term) (phi : form), A ⊢ (∀ phi) -> A ⊢ phi[t0..] where ?p : [R : BSRS ff : falsity_flag rho : env (option (list bool)) t : term u : string bool v : list bool |- peirce]
IE : forall (A : list form) (phi psi : form), A ⊢ (phi --> psi) -> A ⊢ phi -> A ⊢ psi where ?p : [R : BSRS ff : falsity_flag rho : env (option (list bool)) t : term u : string bool v : list bool |- peirce]
der_sing : forall (P : stack ?X) (x y : list ?X), In (x / y) P -> derivable P x y where ?X : [R : BSRS ff : falsity_flag rho : env (option (list bool)) t : term u : string bool v : list bool |- Type]
II : forall (A : list form) (phi psi : form), (phi :: A) ⊢ psi -> A ⊢ (phi --> psi) where ?p : [R : BSRS ff : falsity_flag rho : env (option (list bool)) t : term u : string bool v : list bool |- peirce]
eval_comp : forall (D : Type) (I : interp D) (rho : env D) (xi : nat -> term) (t : term), eval rho t`[xi] = eval (xi >> eval rho) t
iprep_eval : forall (domain : Type) (I : interp domain) (rho : env domain) (x : string bool) (s : term), eval rho (prep x s) = iprep x (eval rho s)
eval_ext : forall (D : Type) (I : interp D) (rho xi : nat -> D) (t : term), (forall x : nat, rho x = xi x) -> eval rho t = eval xi t
IB_enc : forall (R : BSRS) (rho : env (string bool)) (s : string bool), eval rho (enc s) = s
Kripke.ksat_comp : forall (D : Type) (M : Kripke.kmodel D) (ff : falsity_flag) (u : Kripke.nodes (domain:=D)) (rho : nat -> D) (xi : nat -> term) (phi : form), Kripke.ksat u rho phi[xi] < -> Kripke.ksat u (xi >> eval rho) phi
drv_val : forall (R : BSRS) (domain : Type) (I : interp domain) (rho : env domain) (u v : string bool), derivable R u v -> rho ⊨ (F1 R ==> F2 R ==> Pr (enc u) (enc v))
prep_app : forall (x y : list bool) (t : term), prep (x ++ y) t = prep x (prep y t)
sat_subst : forall (D : Type) (I : interp D) (ff : falsity_flag) (rho : env D) (sigma : nat -> term) (phi : form), (forall x : nat, eval rho (sigma x) = rho x) -> rho ⊨ phi < -> rho ⊨ phi[sigma]
IB = B_I (fun f : sig_func => match f as s return (Vector.t (option (string bool)) (ar_syms s) -> option (string bool)) with | s_f b => fun v : Vector.t (option (string bool)) (ar_syms (s_f b)) => match Vector.hd v with | Some u => Some (b :: u) | None => None end | s_e => fun _ : Vector.t (option (string bool)) (ar_syms s_e) => Some [] end) (fun P : sig_pred => match P as s return (Vector.t (option (string bool)) (ar_preds s) -> Prop) with | sPr => fun v : Vector.t (option (string bool)) (ar_preds sPr) => match Vector.hd v with | Some u => match Vector.hd (Vector.tl v) with | Some v0 => derivable R u v0 | None => True end | None => True end | sQ => fun _ : Vector.t (option (string bool))...
derivable_ind : forall (X : Type) (P : stack X) (P0 : string X -> string X -> Prop), (forall x y : list X, In (x / y) P -> P0 x y) -> (forall (x y : list X) (u v : string X), In (x / y) P -> derivable P u v -> P0 u v -> P0 (x ++ u) (y ++ v)) -> forall s s0 : string X, derivable P s s0 -> P0 s s0
sat_comp : forall (D : Type) (I : interp D) (ff : falsity_flag) (rho : env D) (xi : nat -> term) (phi : form), rho ⊨ phi[xi] < -> (xi >> eval rho) ⊨ phi
Inductive derivable (X : Type) (P : stack X) : string X -> string X -> Prop := der_sing : forall x y : list X, In (x / y) P -> derivable P x y | der_cons : forall (x y : list X) (u v : string X), In (x / y) P -> derivable P u v -> derivable P (x ++ u) (y ++ v) Arguments derivable {X}%type_scope Arguments der_sing {X}%type_scope _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments der_cons {X}%type_scope _ (_ _)%list_scope
drv_prv : forall (R : BSRS) (s : peirce) (u v : string bool), derivable R u v -> ctx_S R ⊢ Pr (enc u) (enc v)
Kripke.ksat_ext : forall (D : Type) (M : Kripke.kmodel D) (ff : falsity_flag) (u : Kripke.nodes (domain:=D)) (rho xi : nat -> D) (phi : form), (forall x : nat, rho x = xi x) -> Kripke.ksat u rho phi < -> Kripke.ksat u xi phi
term_ind : forall p : term -> Prop, (forall x : nat, p $x) -> (forall (F : sig_func) (v : Vector.t term (ar_syms F)), (forall t : term, Vector.In t v -> p t) -> p (func F v)) -> forall t : term, p t
cBPCP : forall (P : stack bool) (u : string bool), derivable P u u -> BPCP P
Facts.nthe_app_l : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (n : nat) (A B : list X), nth_error A n = Some x -> nth_error (A ++ B) n = Some x
Position.pos_first_S : forall (X : EqDec.eqType) (x : EqDec.eqType_X X) (l l' : list (EqDec.eqType_X X)) (i : nat), Position.pos x l = Some i -> Position.pos x (l ++ l') = Some i
Position.elAt_app : forall (X : EqDec.eqType) (A : list (EqDec.eqType_X X)) (i : nat) (B : list (EqDec.eqType_X X)) (s : EqDec.eqType_X X), Position.elAt A i = Some s -> Position.elAt (A ++ B) i = Some s
